Articles.Content:
Oi bois! Have you ever tried doing a Xenobiology Project? Feel free to post something about it, but first:

 

What is a Xenobiology Project?

A Xenobiology Project is a project where you think of how life would look like on another celestial body. Thats it, simple.

Some examples of well known Xenobiology Projects are:

Darwin IV from the book Expedition.

Snaiad

 

My Xenobiology project

Back in 2013, i started my first Xenobiology Project. It is in fact my most succesfull project i did on my own!

It takes place on a Moon called Rodinia, the gravity there is 86% of that on Earth and the atmosphere is 2 ATM and almost pure oxygen.

I will post more stuff on my project later.

 

Tips!

1. I always start with a Primium Specium (first species) lifeform, and from that, i start building more and more from it.

2. You could make creatures in Spore if your brain cant make a new lifeform.

3. Make sure your lifeforms look and work differently that our Earthlings, does not matter if it is from the inside or the outside.

4. Keep your Primium Specium special, but simple at the same time, if it is too complex, you wont have any a big enough tree of life

5. You can make multiple Primium Specium if you want to.

 

Thanks for reading, feel free to say anything.
Im working on a new project: The planet of Rinn!
